Bernardo Domenico Leoni

Bernardo Domenico Leoni is a Roman Catholic bishop who has made significant contributions to the field of education, serving as a dean in various academic institutions. Early Life and Education

Leoni was born on April 12, 1955, in Rome, Italy. He pursued his early education at the Pontifical Gregorian University, where he earned a Bachelor's degree in Theology in 1978. He later went on to earn his Doctorate in Canon Law from the Pontifical Lateran University in 1985. Academic Career

Leoni began his academic career as a lecturer at the Pontifical Urbaniana University in 1986, where he taught courses on Canon Law and Moral Theology. In 1992, he was appointed as the Dean of the Faculty of Canon Law at the same university, a position he held until 1998. In 1998, Leoni was appointed as the Dean of the School of Theology at the Catholic University of America, where he served until 2003. During his tenure, he oversaw the development of several new programs, including the establishment of the Center for Catholic Studies. In 2003, Leoni returned to Italy, where he was appointed as the Dean of the Faculty of Theology at the Pontifical Lateran University. He served in this position until 2009, during which time he played a key role in the development of the university's international programs. Episcopal Career

In 2009, Leoni was consecrated as a bishop by Pope Benedict XVI, and was appointed as the Auxiliary Bishop of Rome. In 2012, he was appointed as the Bishop of the Diocese of Viterbo, a position he currently holds.
